fields_of_interest: Competition, Consumers, Education and training, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Food Safety, Climate Action, Communication
inter_groups: Regular participation in Intergroup Climate Change, Biodiversity & Sustainable Development
eu_initiatives:
Common Fisheries Policy (for aquaculture) - Food safety legislation - Aquatic Animal Health Directive - Environmental legislation (Water Framework Directive, Marine Strategy Framework Directive, Biodiversity Directive, Biocides Directive, Birds Directive, Natura 2000). 
Food Security - Bioeconomy - Circular Economy strategies. 
Research and innovation initiatives under Horizon 2020, particularly within scope of Bioeconomy. 
Single Market for Green Products (Product Environment Footprint) 
SMART solutions. Lifelong learning.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Strategic Coordination Group for the Water Framework and Floods Directives#E00371#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=371#Member#C#Chemicals#Expert Group for Markets and Trade in Fishery and Aquaculture Products#E02797#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2797#Member#C#Advisory Group on the Food Chain and Animal and Plant Health#E00860#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=860#Member#C#Animal Health Advisory Committee#EU Platform on Animal Welfare#E03504#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3504#Member#C#Co-ordination Group for Biodiversity and Nature #E02210#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2210#Member#C
membership:
FEAP is a member of the Aquaculture Advisory Council and the Markets Advisory Council. It also participates in other EC Committees, notably concerning animal health, welfare and environmental issues. 
FEAP is a a member of the European Aquaculture Technology and Innovation Platform (EATIP), for whom the FEAP Secretariat provides support facilities - see www.eatip.eu   
It is a member of AquaTnet (primarily a specialised research/training network).   
FEAP also participates - through official liaison status -  in the Aquaculture Committee of the General Fisheries Council of the Mediterranean and the sub-Committee on Aquaculture of the Committee on Fisheries of the FAO. see www.fao.org 
FEAP also has a Memorandum of cooperation with the International Union for the Conservation of Nature, relating to proposals/Actions for assuring the sustainable development of aquaculture.
goals__remit:
The aims of the Federation are the following; 
a.    to develop and establish a common policy on questions relating to the production and the commercialisation of aquaculture species that are reared commercially. 
b.    to make known to the appropriate authorities the common policies envisaged above. 
c.     to promote the development of skills and knowledge within European aquaculture
relevant_communication:
Member of the Aquaculture Advisory Council - Member of Executive Committee and all Working Groups 
Coordinator of 'FindIT' FP7 project - Project 612598 
Participant in EC FP7 projects 'FISHBOOST', 'TRAFOON' and 'ORAQUA' 
Participant in EC Horizon2020 project 'CLIMEFISH' 
Participant in ErasmusPlus projects 'BLUE EDU' and 'OPTIMAL' 
Organiser of 'Aquaculture in Motion' (Autumn each year) 
Organiser of FEAP Annual Meeting 
Publisher of 'FEAP Annual Report' and production statistics (Spring each year) 
Publisher of www.feap.info
